text:
A drug derived from this bushy sea creature showed modest, preliminary promise as an Alzheimer's treatment.

A little-known drug company announced modestly encouraging results for its experimental Alzheimer’s drug on Monday, a rare but still preliminary glimmer of hope in a field that has been battered by failure after failure.

A mid-stage study by a tiny company wouldn’t usually attract much attention, but the results unveiled by Neurotrope (NTRP) BioScience have been eagerly anticipated because its drug — derived from a bushy, hermaphroditic sea creature — takes a novel approach.
title: In small Alzheimer’s study, hints of modest benefit from unusual drug

meta_data.description: A little-known drug company announced modestly encouraging results for its experimental Alzheimer’s drug, but still has a long way to go to prove it works.
